Key Match Events: CJ McCollum scored 38 points to lead the New Orleans Pelicans past the Philadelphia 76ers 123-115.
Paul George had 25 points and 11 rebounds for the Sixers.
Tyrese Maxey had 30 points and 12 assists.
Jordan Hawkins scored 21 points and Dejounte Murray had 17 points and 10 rebounds for the Pelicans.
Hawkins buried a 3 in the third quarter for a 70-67 lead and Murray sank one for a 76-67 lead.
McCollum buried a 3 in the fourth quarter to push the lead back to 10 points and put the finishing touches on the win with a 12-foot step back jumper.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pelicans snapped a two-game losing streak and won for only the third time since Dec. 7.
The 76ers are just 8-15 when Joel Embiid doesn’t play.
The 76ers were pushed to the final minute before holding off the lowly Wizards at home on Wednesday.
The 76ers are 15-21 and hoping at this point just to make the play-in tournament.
